121.title: Waging, or attempting to wage war, or abetting waging of war, against the Government of India
121.legal_text: Whoever wages war against the Government of India, or attempts to wage such war, or abets the waging of such war, shall be punished with death, or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.
121.punishment: Death, or imprisonment for life, and fine
121.nature:
Cognizable
Non-bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Court of Session
121.practical_explanation: Armed rebellion or war against the Indian state.
121.example: Leading an armed insurgent group against the army.
121.conclusion: The most serious offence against the state.

124A.title: Sedition
124A.legal_text: Whoever by words... brings or attempts to bring into hatred or contempt, or excites or attempts to excite disaffection towards the Government established by law in India.
124A.punishment: Imprisonment for life, to which fine may be added, or with imprisonment which may extend to three years, to which fine may be added, or with fine.
124A.nature:
Cognizable
Non-bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Court of Session
124A.practical_explanation: Speech or acts inciting hatred against the government (Note: Supreme Court has paused this law).
124A.example: Speech urging violent overthrow of the government.

193.title: Punishment for false evidence
193.legal_text: Whoever intentionally gives false evidence in any stage of a judicial proceeding, or fabricates false evidence for the purpose of being used in any stage of a judicial proceeding.
193.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine
193.nature:
Non-cognizable
Bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Magistrate of First Class
193.practical_explanation: Lying in court or faking evidence for a trial.

228A.title: Disclosure of identity of the victim of certain offences etc.
228A.legal_text: Whoever prints or publishes the name or any matter which may make known the identity of any person against whom an offence under section 376, 376A... is alleged or committed.
228A.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years and fine
228A.nature:
Cognizable
Bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Any Magistrate
228A.practical_explanation: Revealing the name/photo of a rape victim.
228A.example: Newspaper publishing name of a sexual assault survivor.
228A.conclusion: Protects privacy of sexual offence victims.

230.title: Coin defined
230.legal_text: Coin is metal used for the time being as money, and stamped and issued by the authority of some State or Sovereign Power in order to be so used.

231.title: Counterfeiting coin
231.legal_text: Whoever counterfeits or knowingly performs any part of the process of counterfeiting coin.
231.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine
231.nature:
Cognizable
Non-bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Magistrate of First Class

255.title: Counterfeiting Government stamp
255.legal_text: Whoever counterfeits, or knowingly performs any part of the process of counterfeiting, any stamp issued by Government for the purpose of revenue.
255.punishment: Imprisonment for life or up to 10 years and fine
255.nature:
Cognizable
Non-bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Court of Session

295.title: Injuring or defiling place of worship with intent to insult the religion of any class
295.legal_text: Whoever destroys, damages or defiles any place of worship, or any object held sacred by any class of persons...
295.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both
295.nature:
Cognizable
Non-bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Any Magistrate
295.practical_explanation: Vandalizing a temple, mosque, church, etc.
295.example: Throwing garbage into a holy shrine.

296.title: Disturbing religious assembly
296.legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes disturbance to any assembly lawfully engaged in the performance of religious worship, or religious ceremonies.
296.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both
296.nature:
Cognizable
Bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Any Magistrate
296.practical_explanation: Disrupting a prayer meeting or religious procession.
296.example: Playing loud music intentionally to disrupt prayers.

297.title: Trespassing on burial places, etc.
297.legal_text: Whoever, with the intention of wounding the feelings of any person, or of insulting the religion of any person... commits any trespass in any place of worship or on any place of sepulchre.
297.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both
297.nature:
Cognizable
Bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Any Magistrate

298.title: Uttering, words, etc., with deliberate intent to wound the religious feelings of any person
298.legal_text: Whoever, with the deliberate intention of wounding the religious feelings of any person, utters any word or makes any sound in the hearing of that person...
298.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both
298.nature:
Non-cognizable
Bailable
Compoundable (with permission)
Triable by Any Magistrate
298.practical_explanation: Speaking specifically to hurt someone's religious feelings.
298.example: Using slurs against someone's god to their face.

312.title: Causing miscarriage
312.legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes a woman with child to miscarry, shall, if such miscarriage be not caused in good faith for the purpose of saving the life of the woman, be punished.
312.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both (7 years if quick with child)
312.nature:
Non-cognizable
Bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Magistrate of First Class
312.example: Forcing someone to have an abortion without medical necessity.

313.title: Causing miscarriage without woman's consent
313.legal_text: Whoever commits the offence defined in the last preceding section without the consent of the woman...
313.punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine
313.nature:
Cognizable
Non-bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Court of Session
313.practical_explanation: Forcing an abortion on a woman against her will.
313.example: Husband spiking wife's drink to cause miscarriage.

330.title: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property
330.legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt for the purpose of extorting from the sufferer or any person interested in the sufferer any confession...
330.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine
330.nature:
Cognizable
Bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Magistrate of First Class
330.practical_explanation: Police or anyone beating someone to get a confession.
330.example: Custodial torture to get a confession.

388.title: Extortion by threat of accusation of an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life, etc.
388.legal_text: Whoever commits extortion by putting any person in fear of an accusation against that person... of having committed or attempted to commit any offence punishable with death...
388.punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine (Life if offence threatened is unnatural offence)
388.nature:
Cognizable
Non-bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Court of Session
388.practical_explanation: Blackmailing someone by threatening to accuse them of a serious crime like murder or rape.
388.example: Threatening to file a false rape case unless paid.

overlaps.description: Putting person in fear of accusation

493.title: Cohabitation caused by a man deceitfully inducing a belief of lawful marriage
493.legal_text: Every man who by deceit causes any woman who is not lawfully married to him to believe that she is lawfully married to him and to cohabit with him...
493.punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years and fine
493.nature:
Non-cognizable
Non-bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Magistrate of First Class
493.practical_explanation: Tricking a woman into believing she is married to you to have sex.
493.example: Performing a fake wedding ceremony to live with a woman.

496.title: Marriage ceremony fraudulently gone through without lawful marriage
496.legal_text: Whoever, dishonestly or with a fraudulent intention, goes through the ceremony of being married, knowing that he is not thereby lawfully married...
496.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine
496.nature:
Non-cognizable
Bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Magistrate of First Class
496.example: Pretending to marry just to get dowry/status.

505.title: Statements conducing to public mischief
505.legal_text: Whoever makes, publishes or circulates any statement, rumor or report... with intent to cause, or which is likely to cause, any officer, soldier... to mutiny... or to cause fear or alarm to the public.
505.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years (or 5 years in place of worship)
505.nature:
Cognizable
Non-bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Any Magistrate
505.practical_explanation: Spreading rumors to cause panic or mutiny.
505.example: Circulating fake news causing a riot.

507.title: Criminal intimidation by an anonymous communication
507.legal_text: Whoever commits the offence of criminal intimidation by an anonymous communication, or having taken precaution to conceal the name...
507.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years (in addition to Section 506 punishment)
507.nature:
Non-cognizable
Bailable
Non-compoundable
Triable by Magistrate of First Class
507.practical_explanation: Threatening someone anonymously (e.g. unknown caller, anonymous letter).

508.title: Act caused by inducing person to believe that he will be rendered an object of the Divine displeasure
508.legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes or attempts to cause any person to do anything which that person is not legally bound to do... by inducing... belief that he... will become an object of Divine displeasure.
508.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both
508.nature:
Non-cognizable
Bailable
Compoundable
Triable by Any Magistrate
508.practical_explanation: Scaring someone into doing something by claiming God will punish them.
508.example: A godman threatening a curse if a devotee doesn't donate money.

501.title: Printing or engraving matter known to be defamatory
501.legal_text: Whoever prints or engraves any matter, knowing or having good reason to believe that such matter is defamatory of any person.
501.punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both
501.nature:
Non-cognizable
Bailable
Compoundable
Triable by Magistrate of First Class
501.example: Printing a magazine full of lies about someone.
